11.name: Kristen
11.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2024
11.title: So soft, no leaks, non-toxic..
11.review: What is there not to love? They're so soft! My son is mostly potty trained while wearing these so his accidents were mostly small bits of urine while rushing to the bathroom so I can't speak for how they hold up for a child that isn't potty trained at all, but I bet they'll be perfect even then! I love these!

12.name: Roseanne
12.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2024
12.title: Great absorbancy
12.review: This is one of the few non-toxic brands that sell pull-ups for larger sizes that actually absorb the pee. These are great for nighttime; I've had no issues with leaking and the fit it comfortable yet snug where it needs to be.

13.name: Angela
13.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
13.title: Not great for overnight
13.review: My son is full potty trained during the day but still needs to wear training pants at night. We had an issue with other eco-friendly training pants with leaking though the legs or the top during the night. These Eco Boom training pants fit wonderfully and do not leak the same way, however, the liquid gets absorbed all the way to the outside of the training pants if worn all night. There is not protective too layer keeping the urine inside. This isn’t a problem if he stays dry until the wee hours of the morning, but if he urinates within the first few hours of falling asleep, he will end up soaked and the training pants deteriorating. We will finish the package with the PUL cover on top and then continue our search for the best overnight non-toxic training pants!

14.name: Dana from the Lone Star State
14.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
14.title: Will reorder
14.review: I ordered these after the Pull-ups brand broke my toddler out in a rash. These are soft and so far haven’t leaked when there have been accidents. I used the sizing recommendation and it was accurate. They’re not as cutesy as some other brands, but after the first day, my little one didn’t seem to notice or care. And I love that there’s been no rash or irritation. I’ll be reordering!

15.name: Tori Cerynik
15.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
15.title: Best brand of diapers and pull ups
15.review: These are by far my favorite brand of diapers and pull ups! The pull ups I don’t recommend unless your kid is potty training or potty trained already. They aren’t designed to hold the amount of pee like a diaper bc they are a pull up. We used the diapers prior to being potty trained and they hold sooo much pee over night. During and after potty training, we switched to the pull ups cause it’s easier for him to take on and off himself. The pull up still holds a lot of pee at night but not nearly as much as the diapers (bc they aren’t designed to).

16.name: Joel H
16.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024
16.title: Sizing not the same as Huggies or other brands
16.review: So, I love the cleaner materials especially with my 3 year old having a lot of sensitivity to diapers, but the sizing doesn’t match with Huggies, Pampers, or Kirkland (at least for our kids). Even though my 3 year old I only weighs 26 lbs, she is tall and wears 4-5 T clothes. For overnight diapers she wears size 6 or in pull ups (4-5T). With this in mind, I got the equivalent size in Eco Boom. There’s are huge! They are a lot longer than the other diapers and they are very in the front area though not wide enough in the bottom area. It fits very weird. My toddler also complained these felt scratchy. I am reluctant to try a size down because of them feeling scratchy to her. I will continue my search for overnight pull ups. These diapers may be true to the recommended weight; however, I don’t think they would work for kiddos that are slim and tall.

17.name: Jared G
17.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
17.title: The largest Pullup I can find.
17.review: The Dyper brand has been out of stock for months and we ran out of their 5T/6T my older son (60lb but skinny) sometimes needs at night. These are the first ones we've found that fit.

18.name: Syndra
18.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
18.title: Good
18.review: I like it. Good shape to fit my baby's butt and good material. Even if the baby urinates a lot, the surface remains dry after a whole night. No prints👍🏻，so clean but why there's no tape on the back？

19.name: Don Murphy
19.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
19.title: Very absorbent
19.review: As far as healthy, clean options…these reign supreme. They definitely hold up overnight, sized well, and very absorbent.

20.name: Amy
20.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
20.title: Soft and really absorbent
20.review: We use these just at night and they work great

21.name: Ruthie Petersen
21.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
21.title: Everything
21.review: For twin toddlers. True to size,worked well

22.name: Laraine Reynolds
22.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
22.title: Fits Great
22.review: Very soft training pants and they fit great.

23.name: Luis Guzman
23.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
23.title: Garbage & from China 🤦🏾‍♂️

24.name: TwoMama!
24.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2025
24.title: Soft and super stretchy
24.review: I’ve tried Eco Boom bamboo diapers before, so I was excited to use these pull up style ones. The training pants are very soft to the touch, and fairly thick for training pants! The waistband and leg openings are very stretchy, but the waist is a little on the smaller side. Length wise, these do run bigger than I was expecting (especially for being size 5). My 21 month old is still under 30 pounds and wears regular size 6 diapers, but the bottom part of these training pants were slightly saggy and fit more like a size 7 diaper. The diaper themselves don’t leak through like a traditional training pant, so these are truly more comparable to Pampers 360 diapers! The wetness indicator is accurate, and these do hold a fairly decent amount of liquid. Although these are saggy at the bottom, I haven’t had any issues with leaks out the side for any type of liquid or solid. These are great for daytime diapers, but not for overnight. My toddler gets irritation rashes easily, but these are perfect for sensitive skin, and they’re fragrance free! Even with being stretched out all the way, I haven’t had any of these diapers accidentally ripping open during the day or while being pulled up- it does take a considerate amount of force to tear them off. The only downside is that there’s no sticky tab anywhere on the diaper to keep it rolled up when it needs discarded. I think these XL training pants are great diapers for active infants and toddlers!

25.name: Steve
25.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2025
25.title: pretty decent but got some quirks
25.review: for my lil dude, and they’re pretty solid overall. they’re super soft and don’t irritate his sensitive skin, which is a big win. they fit him nicely (he’s around 25 lbs), and they don’t leak much, even when he sleeps. but, here’s the deal: they don’t hold up as long as i’d hoped when he has a big accident. also, the sides are kinda hard to tear when you’re in a rush. they’re good for daytime use, though. just gotta change ‘em quick if things get messy. not perfect, but they get the job done.

26.name: CG
26.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025
26.title: Disposable bamboo training pants by ECO BOOM
26.review: These disposable training pants from ECO BOOM have been working well for my daughter. She is 31 lbs, so she is on the higher end of the recommended weight range for the large size. They fit her well though, and they're very soft. My daughter is only potty trained during the day, so we only use them overnight. They contain her urine if/when she goes in her sleep. I'm not sure how they do during the day on a little one that is more active. They're a bit pricey ($43.99 at the time of this review plus a 5% off coupon), but that's to be expected for bamboo-anything.

27.name: JC
27.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025
27.title: Slightly more eco-conscious pull-ups
27.review: This is probably still not the most eco-friendly way (I suspect that'd be washable, or just get to undies ASAP), but they're a pretty good middle ground. They work just as well as name-brand easy ups, with perhaps a slightly bulkier fit.

28.name: CustomerReview
28.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2025
28.title: Large pack of training pants. Cleaner than Pull-ups and good fit.
28.review: So easy to use and great for night-time especially. Pull up well and have good fit on the sides and at waist. Soft, comfy and stretchy waist. Love the brand for clean and green products.

29.name: Eevee
29.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2025
29.title: Fantastic Quality Training Pants
29.review:
These are super soft and feel very nice on the skin! I'm not my son but he says they feel nice as well. They are a little bulky so depending on the size pants your child is wearing, they might give more of that diaper look than a normal diaper but if your child usually wears pants a little looser or a size up, then you won't notice it as much. It has great absorption and is perfect for when they're just learning and you want something they can pull up and down themselves for that sense of independence.

There is no scent to these which is great since I hate added chemicals to something going on my child's tush. These feel just so soft and must be very comfortable to wear and is a good in between diapers and underwear.

30.name: Sam
30.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025
30.title: Large pull-up style diapers - I'd advise to size down
30.review:
I didn't realize that these were like pull ups, but I like that about them. My baby is exiting size 4 and about to be ready for size 5, and I use Pampers normally. These diapers seem significantly larger than my current size 4 than I'm using. However since we're about ready to move to size 5, these diapers fit alright. It looks kind of big but that may just be the shape of it because feeling around and all, the diaper does seem to fit fine. I hope that helps figure out sizing for you.

The diapers seem to be soft and comfortable, no complaints or perceived uncomfortability. Handled a nice amount of urine, yet to have #2 yet but I'm sure it will be fine (can update review on a disappointing blowout should that happen).

These diapers are easy to pull up and easy to break to take off. The pull-up style diaper is better for comfort and easier to get on that your standard diaper, which is nice. If you're looking for an eco-friendly bamboo diaper, I am happy to recommend these!

31.name: Jen
31.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2025
31.title: Excellent quality!
31.review: We've used ECO BOOM diapers in the past, so I was excited to give their training pants a try! They fit our kiddo well. They are soft, and he said they felt comfortable to wear. Quite absorbent! We haven't had any leaks with these.

32.name: Critical Reviewer
32.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2025
32.title: Great pull up style diapers
32.review: These are great pull-up style diapers. If you are using Elimination Communication, these can work for children at a younger age and be good protection while you learn their signals. So far, she hasn't had any blowouts, and she hasn't experienced any rashes.

33.name: Ryan
33.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2025
33.title: ECO BOOM TRAINING PANTS FOR TODDLER POTTY
33.review:
These hypoallergenic training pants are designed for toddlers with sensitive skin, providing comfort and leakage protection for potty training.

Pros:
_ Hypoallergenic and gentle on sensitive skin
_ Stretchy waistband for a secure and comfortable fit
_ Absorbent core prevents leaks during potty training
_ Size 4 fits toddlers 20-31 lbs (48 count per pack)

Cons:

_ Slightly pricier than conventional training pants

Final Verdict: A great choice for parents seeking a gentle, eco-friendly potty training solution with soft and absorbent materials.

34.name: Echo G
34.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2025
34.title: Working well so far
34.review: The first thing I noticed was that these were pretty soft. They seem to absorb pretty well and the fit is fairly accurate. The sides rip like they should when you tear them but don't tear apart unless you do it on purpose. The material seems to be decent quality and they haven't leaked so far. It is a little more pricey than store brands but quality is worth a little more cost.

35.name: June A.
35.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
35.title: soft, easy to wear
35.review: This was a good hypoallergenic diaper. I did not give my kiddo a rash. It holds a good amount of waste for training pants. My kid had no complaints to it.

36.name: HeddaGabler
36.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2025
36.title: High quality pull ups
36.review:
These diapers are high quality and super soft. Very easy to get on and off!

We are just considering potty training with out 13.5 month old with a goal of having him trained by 18 months. I know, I know - people will gasp with shock about this today, but somehow in the 1950s 92% of kids were trained by that age, so it is possible for almost all children. Let's see what happens!

Anyway, these diapers are super soft and absorbent and seem really comfortable for my nany to wear. I will say that these are snug on my 26.5 pound child. I would say size up if you are close to the weight limit.

Overall, really nice, trustworthy and quality diapers and I will be buying them again.

37.name: B
37.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2025
37.title: soft!
37.review: SO soft! and great for my 2.5 year old. My son is now day potty trained and we have been using these for nights, it absorbs great, doesn't bother him and are SO soft! They are a bit pricey so I recommend trying it for kiddos with specific sensitives.

38.name: GreekGX
38.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
38.title: Environmentally-conscious training diapers
38.review: These were excellent diapers that do not have any problems to them. They are sustainably made and I like that very much with this brand. When we used them, we saw no leaks from our kid. Although I usually use a different brand, I didn't purchase them in time, but I would absolutely get these again if I ever needed them.

39.name: Mari
39.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2025
39.title: Perfect for potty training
39.review: We are in the process of potty training and these pull-up diapers are very convenient. They fit my toddler perfectly and are nice and comfortable. They absorb very well and we havent had any issues with leaking so far. They pull up and down very easily and are nice and thick. Comes in 3 separate packs with a total of 48 in the entire box. Great quality diapers!

40.name: Customer
40.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2025
40.title: Incredible diapers
40.review: These diapers remind me of a vastly improved version of Pampers pull ups. They are soft like Coterie but not as bulky. The absorbency blows Pampers out of the water, and they do not get lumpy the way Pampers do after a big pee. I'm using these overnight for my son and we've had zero problems. The elastic waist provides an excellent fit and it's very stretchy. SO impressed with these diapers. We will be ordering more!

41.name: Nova
41.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2025
41.title: Nice and Soft
41.review:
These training pants are great to wear on child who is potty training; they are perfect to wear during the day or overnight. They are soft and made from bamboo; they are gentle on the skin.

Easy to put on and take off. And since you are not changing them as much, the price for 48 is reasonable.

ECO BOOM Training Pants for Toddler Potty, Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Skin, Size 4 Suitable for 20 to 31lb (L - 48 Count)

42.name: winampplayer
42.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025
42.title: Soft and easy to slip on and off
42.review: The ECO BOOM Training Pants for Toddler Potty in size 4 is meant for 20-31 lbs. These training pants fit my toddler perfectly. They are very soft and easy to slip on and off. I prefer to use disposable training pants and then switching him over to underwear when he has less accidents to avoid more messes. Hopefully just one pack, which contain 48 training pants, will be enough before transitioning.

43.name: AH
43.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2025
43.title: Soft and Absorbent
43.review: Very soft trainers with soft elastic side bands. I like that the absorbent bad goes all the way up the front and back. The front of the trainers are marked as such. There is also a wetness indicator line.

44.name: Amanda
44.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
44.title: Works great
44.review: These Training Pants for Toddlers are an excellent choice for potty training! Designed with hypoallergenic materials, they’re gentle on sensitive skin, preventing irritation and discomfort. The size 4 fits toddlers weighing 20 to 31 lbs perfectly, providing a secure and comfortable fit. They’re highly absorbent to handle little accidents while still allowing toddlers to feel wetness for effective potty training. The soft, flexible design ensures ease of movement, making them comfortable for active toddlers. With 48 in a pack, they offer great value. Highly recommended for stress-free and gentle potty training!

45.name: Amazon_customer_k
45.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2025
45.title: Ecoboom training pants
45.review: These are amazing. I love this brand!! I’ve tried their diapers and was so excited to grab these! They’re so soft and soooo absorbent. The sides are nice and wide. Very stretchy. And you are able to rip the sides without fuss, if needed. I’m over the heels with these.

46.name: H. K.
46.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2025
46.title: Soft
46.review: These training pants are great - soft and decently absorbent. Very useful for overnight while potty training in the daytime.

47.name: Ava
47.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
47.title: Sturdy and well made
47.review: These Training Pants for Toddlers are perfect for potty training! The hypoallergenic material is gentle on sensitive skin, ensuring comfort while preventing irritation. Size 4 fits toddlers weighing 20 to 31 lbs, offering a secure and snug fit for active little ones. These training pants are highly absorbent, providing protection during accidents while encouraging independence during the potty training process. With 48 in the pack, they offer great value for everyday use. Highly recommended for parents looking for a reliable, gentle, and effective training pant option!

48.name: cat
48.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2025
48.title: Should Do Fine
48.review: Our youngest (and last) grandchild will soon be big enough for these. She's often over here with her parents, who live fairly close, so we keep various baby supplies handy, just in case. The size range covered, ease of use, and disposability prompted us to get these for a try. The granddaughter has a few pounds to go before these are a good fit, but her mother has checked them out and given her approval. Works for us!

49.name: Penguin
49.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025
49.title: Good
49.review: Good fit and snug in all the right places—also has some stretch to it so movement seems easy—they also aren’t bulky which is a plus and I love how I don’t have to worry too much about leakage.

50.name: ScottStyles
50.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2025
50.title: Toddler pants
50.review: These were not absorbent as much as my usual pampers pullups however they are good for light incidents and for sensitive skin we did not have any outbreaks or issues with these

51.name: Lisa
51.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2025
51.title: Bamboo
51.review: I love that these are made with bamboo. They are soft and absorbent. This is a great pack.

52.name: Big Daddy
52.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025
52.title: Nice!
52.review: Nice diapers! Very soft and absorbent. Hypoallergenic materials kept our grandsons from getting any irritation. Fit well — nice & snug.

53.name: VK
53.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025
53.title: Soft and Absorbent Training Pants
53.review: These training pants are very soft and high-quality. They fit my 26 lb child perfectly and are super absorbent, even for overnight use. The pack comes with 48 pants, which is great.

54.name: HeyThatsConnie
54.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2025
54.title: Huge box of quality diapers.
54.review: Nice quality. Leakproof. Absorbent. Soft on the baby’s skin. Size is proper.

55.name: Amb
55.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2024
55.title: Pretty good compared to the brand name we use
55.review:
I'm comparing these to the brand-name potty-training diapers I have. Aside from no pretty pictures (not important for us, and my daughter doesn't care) on the diaper, they're overall just as good.

Size/coverage: They're a little taller than the brand name. Not by much, but this has been helpful since my daughter is currently between sizes. The width is about the same. This brand is a little rounder, sSo it covers a little more of her bottom.

The stretchy straps on the sides are shorter on this brand, but they have more pull to them without being too loose. They're a little softer.

The absorbent area is similar in thickness and coverage, yet the brand name is just slightly softer. The difference is so small I don't think it matters. The brand name holds liquid a little better, but we haven’t had any accidents and this brand doesn’t slip off her bottom as easily when she’s active.

If you don't care about looks (again, not a deal breaker here) these are pretty good compared to the brand name, they're better if you need a bit more coverage without going up a size.

56.name: kttiekat
56.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
56.title: Potty training is always a process
56.review: I liked the price and hypoallergenic nature of these training pants. I can only say that I wish they would hold up a bit better during nap time or night time accidents. These seem to leak out the sides more then some other brands we used with our other 2 sons.

57.name: Verified Purchase
57.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
57.title: Great absorbency, no leaks, and tear off fairly easily
57.review: So far we've been using these pull ups after we ran out of our Huggies and Honest ones. They feel pretty soft from the outside. And in comparison, hold up really well. Our daughter is going through a potty training regression, so we've had our fair share of incredibly messy incidents. And not once has anything fallen out with these. They tear very easily from the sides, especially since I sometimes only have one hand to take them off and be prepared to clean up. They also hold a lot. Sometimes my daughter will go 2-3 times (#1) and when I take them off, they are so heavy but I'm shocked that nothing has leaked out! The only reason I don't rate them a 5 is that on more than one occasion, she has tried to pull them down and says "it hurts". So I don't know if they feel a little dry for her and rub up or something. We will usually take them off and apply a different brand and she's fine. Then we try again with these and have no issues. Not sure if coincidence or if she really doesn't like the feel of them at times.

58.name: L
58.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
58.title: Perfect even for overnight!
58.review: We are right at the middle of potty training process so I was really excited to try this pull-ups. He doesn’t really wear anything thru the day because he is really good on going to potty but naps and night different story. He wore them overnight and as picture reflects he had to go few times. When I took it of he was dry and no prints on his skin, meaning material is gentle but absorbs moisture quickly. Super gentle on his skin and perfect for night time. He is almost 3 and sizing is perfect for us, very happy with these pull-up and it will last us at least few months. High quality, absorbs quickly and perfect for overnight!

59.name: Nicole Tilford
59.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
59.title: Will be great
59.review: Once my baby is old enough for potty training I think these will be great. I’ve used them a few times so far as they are her size and they hold well. I like the packaging, very eco friendly

60.name: Heather A
60.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
60.title: XL fits size 3T-4T pull up
60.review: I got these to try for my toddler. The material is so so soft and very absorbent. They hold just as much, if not more than our usual Pull-Up. The XL is comparable in size to a size 3T-4T pull-up. I knocked off a star only because they are a little bulkier than pull ups and seem like they wouldn’t be as comfortable with the added bulk.

61.name: Jana F
61.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
61.title: Soft and comfy on baby's skin
61.review:
ECO BOOM Toddler Potty Training Pants

First, I really like how soft these potty training pants are, especially around the waist and legs. Some pants chafe the skin but these do not. Might be because of the aloe in these which I love.

This size 3 is small for a potty-training child so also could easily be used as a diaper. There's nothing fancy about these pants, however they are very nice.

62.name: Super Reviewer
62.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
62.title: ECO BOOM Toddler Potty Training Pants
62.review: I like that these are free from alcohol, chlorine, latex, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulfates, and phthalates. I have been using them as an overnight pull up for my child that is newly potty trained. They run large so I would suggest sizing down. The training pants did not cause any irritation, I like that these are plain and have no additional prints, gender neutral and they have a wetness indicator.

63.name: Anna K.
63.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
63.title: Soft and absorbent, run huge.
63.review: My oldest turned 3 a week before I got these diapers. My twins were 21 months. I had a size 4,5,6 diapers all represented, and I was low on 4's so I ordered these in that size and they only fit my big girl. They ran huge and were soft and very absorbent, didn't tear or anything and were nice but very big. Thankfully we were still able to use them but be VERY wary of the sizing listed

64.name: Sara Quiller
64.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
64.title: These diapers are good!
64.review: These are very soft, good diapers. They don't smell like chemicals or anything. My only slight complaint is that they run a little bit so I would probably size down from your normal size.

65.name: K K OBrien
65.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2023
65.title: Great for sliding onto wiggly legs!
65.review: I have a one year old who is becoming more wise to diaper changes and definitely learned that he can wiggle and twist to attempt and escape mid diaper duty. I wasn't sure whether this baby pant style diaper would be easier to get on him but I am so glad I tried them because they have made things so much better! You don't have to worry about strapping and positioning flaps just right like a typical diaper - just pull them up and you're good to go! I think I would say this brand runs a little bit larger if you are comparing size to size between brands, but I think the range they state is pretty accurate! The diapers seem to stay in place even with my constantly on the move little guy with no leaking or sliding down.

66.name: Kaila
66.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
66.title: Soft with stretchy sides
66.review:
These baby pants are similar to pull ups. Very soft material with stretchy sides. They’re disposable so good to use if you’re trying to potty train.
Each one has a yellow line indicator so you can see if your child has peed.
Sizing seems to be true to size, I’d say a tad on the bigger size but it will really depend how your kid’s built. Mine is taller for his age so even though he’s in the higher end of the weight limit for these, they fit a little larger on him around the waist. So it’ll totally vary depending on each child.
Overall I feel like the quality is good, they’re really soft and seem comfortable on, and I like that they help with the transition from diaper to underwear.

67.name: Workin’ Mom
67.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
67.title: Excellent quality

68.name: Mom's Opinion
68.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
68.title: Excellent
68.review:
I got these Training Pants for my Granddaughter for when she comes over to visit or I watch her. They are soft and have great absorbency and fit great. Don't leak and don't sag. She seems to be very comfortable in them, no complaints yet. I just tear them off when taking them off and tear off easy.

I Recommend them, they are great.

69.name: mandy
69.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
69.title: Very Good Quality
69.review: These are awesome! I currently had a popular brand's "easy ups" on hand to compare this product to. These are soo much softer in comparison - especially the elastic/stretchy part. They seem like they are much more comfortable. I like the neural white & plain look that these have as opposed to the character designs on other brands. Overall, I think the quality of these are great and they work very well for their intended purpose.

70.name: Mesully01
70.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
70.title: True to size and work great
70.review: I got these pull ups for my 18 month old son to begin potty training and we really like them. We just started transitioning him from Costco size 5 diapers to size 6 so that’s what we ordered. As shown in my images these size 6 are the exact same size as the Kirkland brand size 6. These are on the left with Costco diapers to the right. They are absorbent and very soft and Comfortable. We are just beginning potty training and like that these go on and off easily without stretching out or breaking down.

71.name: Supermom55
71.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
71.title: Very good, soft training diapers.
71.review: The diapers are soft and are not irritating the skin. They haven't leaked at all. They go up and down quite easily but they are a bit bigger than I expected. I got a size 6 because that's the size my son wears in his diapers and these aren't as snug. Since they are a tad bigger and haven't leaked I feel like they have very good absorbency. Will definitely be getting more of this brand.

72.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
72.title: Great
72.review: Very absorbant and soft. Nice neutral packaging and holds a good amount for overnight. Easy to pull up and down.

73.name: AmazonCustomer
73.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
73.title: Natural
73.review: Nice pull up training diapers. My daughter still has accidents during night time sleep and these are nicer than our usual ones. They are easy to get on and off. No scents/chemicals and most importantly, no leaks! My daughter is a size 4 diaper but size 3 fit her well so they do run slightly big. They feel soft and comfortable.

74.name: StarBright
74.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2023
74.title: Easy to pull on
74.review: I ordered an XL for my 30 lb 2 year old. He needs them for the night at times. When he has an accident they absorb well. The XL leaves some room for him to grow into, but still fits snug enough for use. If I used them nightly, I would have just ordered the L.

75.name: Dee
75.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
75.title: Bamboo Pull Ups
75.review: These potty training pants are easy to pull on and off and very absorbent. Great eco-friendly option for potty training process.

76.name: Doris
76.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
76.title: Soft
76.review: These diaper a so soft and hold much pee and never experienced a leak with this . I like this because it doesn’t have any cartons it doesn’t show through the clothes specially the light one.

77.name: TreeHouseTally
77.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
77.title: Surprisingly good!
77.review: I wasn't sure about these but they appear to work well. My daughter is slightly taller and with thick legs so these fit great. I think they may be slightly large with the sizing though. However, they are absorbent and ultra soft. A great alternative to the big brands.

78.name: Bettyhop
78.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
78.title: Very absorbent and perfect anytime night or day
78.review: My grand daughter is not quite ready for potty training, a little stubborn and these are so much nicer than regular pull ups. They don't leak, environmentally safer and very soft. The sizing is perfect and I'm very happy with these pull ups. Price is comparable with other pullups and well worth the purchase.

80.review: I love these Potty Training Pants....They fit the child well and don't leak...I love they are environmentally friendly

81.name: Charity
81.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
81.title: Surprisingly soft
81.review: These training pants are the softest I've ever encountered. My son is 40 lbs. and the size 6 fit very well with plenty of room to spare. I like that the design is simple and they aren't made with unnecessary material. The only drawback is they are visible under clothing without the pants being full. We are use to a slim fitting pull-up.

82.name: Real Review
82.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
82.title: bulky
82.review: These are thick and bulky, definitely feel like a diaper and not a pre-underwear training pants. The only way they are like training pants is that they pull up and down easily. But they are much more bulky than my regular size 4 diapers and absorb about the same. I won't buy them again.

83.name: Yesenia Ramirez

83.review:
His little buns were out almost completely.
The fit is not right.
I went according to the size chart but there’s just something off about this diapers.
I did like that they don’t have a smell and they are soft.
But won’t be able to use them because of the fit.
